intro: Oreogenia filiformis, commonly known as the slender mountain orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its slender, filament-like stems and small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil, often growing in rocky crevices or on exposed slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to minimize water loss in its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, Oreogenia filiformis is considered a vulnerable species.
